sentences.zh: 秦之先，帝顓頊之苗裔孫曰女修。

translations.literal: The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu, a remote grandson named Nüxiu.
translations.idiomatic: The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu, a remote grandson named Nüxiu.

sentences.zh: 女修織，玄鳥隕卵，女修吞之，生子大業。

translations.literal: Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg; Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye.
translations.idiomatic: Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg; Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye.

sentences.zh: 大業取少典之子，曰女華。

translations.literal: Daye married the daughter of Shaodian, named Nühua.
translations.idiomatic: Daye married the daughter of Shaodian, named Nühua.

sentences.zh: 女華生大費，與禹平水土。

translations.literal: Nühua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu control the floods.
translations.idiomatic: Nühua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu control the floods.

sentences.zh: 已成，帝錫玄圭。

translations.literal: When this was accomplished, the emperor bestowed a black jade tablet.
translations.idiomatic: When this was accomplished, the emperor bestowed a black jade tablet.

sentences.zh: 禹受曰：「非予能成，亦大費為輔。」

translations.literal: Yu accepted it saying: 'It was not my ability alone that accomplished this; Da Fei was my assistant.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu accepted it saying: 'It was not my ability alone that accomplished this; Da Fei was my assistant.'

sentences.zh: 帝舜曰：「咨爾費，贊禹功，其賜爾皁游。

translations.literal: Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei, you aided Yu's achievements. I grant you a black banner.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei, you aided Yu's achievements. I grant you a black banner.

sentences.zh: 爾後嗣將大出。」

translations.literal: Your descendants will greatly multiply.'
translations.idiomatic: Your descendants will greatly multiply.'

sentences.zh: 乃妻之姚姓之玉女。

translations.literal: He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan.
translations.idiomatic: He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan.

sentences.zh: 大費拜受，佐舜調馴鳥獸，鳥獸多馴服，是為柏翳。

translations.literal: Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi.

sentences.zh: 舜賜姓嬴氏。

translations.literal: Shun granted the surname Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Shun granted the surname Ying.

Your descendants will greatly multiply.' He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan. Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi. Shun granted the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 大費生子二人：一曰大廉，實鳥俗氏；

translations.literal: Bai Yi's descendants became numerous.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Yi's descendants became numerous.

sentences.zh: 二曰若木，實費氏。

translations.literal: The second was Ruo Mu, who was the ancestor of the Fei clan.
translations.idiomatic: The second was Ruo Mu, who was the ancestor of the Fei clan.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰費昌，子孫或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: His great-grandson was Fei Chang, whose descendants were sometimes in the Central States, sometimes among the barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was Fei Chang, whose descendants were sometimes in the Central States, sometimes among the barbarians.

sentences.zh: 費昌當夏桀之時，去夏歸商，為湯御，以敗桀於鳴條。

translations.literal: Fei Chang, during the time of Xia Jie, left Xia and went to Shang, drove for Tang, and defeated Jie at Mingtiao.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Chang, during the time of Xia Jie, left Xia and went to Shang, drove for Tang, and defeated Jie at Mingtiao.

sentences.zh: 大廉玄孫曰孟戲、中衍，鳥身人言。

translations.literal: Da Lian's great-grandsons were Meng Xi and Zhong Yan, who had bird bodies and human speech.
translations.idiomatic: Da Lian's great-grandsons were Meng Xi and Zhong Yan, who had bird bodies and human speech.

sentences.zh: 帝太戊聞而卜之使御，吉，遂致使御而妻之。

translations.literal: Emperor Tai Wu heard of it and divined to have them drive his chariot; it was auspicious, so he had them drive and married them wives.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Tai Wu heard of it and divined to have them drive his chariot; it was auspicious, so he had them drive and married them wives.

sentences.zh: 自太戊以下，中衍之後，遂世有功，以佐殷國，故嬴姓多顯，遂為諸侯。

translations.literal: From Tai Wu downward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation had merit, assisting the Yin state, therefore the Ying surname became prominent, and became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: From Tai Wu downward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation had merit, assisting the Yin state, therefore the Ying surname became prominent, and became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰中潏，在西戎，保西垂。

translations.literal: His great-grandson was Zhong Hao, in the Western Rong, guarded the western frontier.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was Zhong Hao, in the Western Rong, guarded the western frontier.

sentences.zh: 生蜚廉。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Fei Lian.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Fei Lian.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉生惡來。

translations.literal: Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai.

sentences.zh: 惡來有力，蜚廉善走，父子俱以材力事殷紂。

translations.literal: E Lai was strong, Fei Lian was good at running, father and son both served King Zhou of Yin with their strength and abilities.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai was strong, Fei Lian was good at running, father and son both served King Zhou of Yin with their strength and abilities.

sentences.zh: 周武王之伐紂，并殺惡來。

translations.literal: When King Wu of Zhou attacked Zhou, he also killed E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou attacked Zhou, he also killed E Lai.

sentences.zh: 是時蜚廉為紂石北方，還，無所報，為壇霍太山而報，得石棺，銘曰「帝令處父不與殷亂，賜爾石棺以華氏」。

translations.literal: At this time Fei Lian was building stone walls in the north for Zhou, returned, had nothing to report, built an altar at Huo Mountain to make a report, obtained a stone coffin, inscribed: 'The Emperor commands Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's disorder, grants you this stone coffin to make your clan flourish.'
translations.idiomatic: At this time Fei Lian was building stone walls in the north for Zhou, returned, had nothing to report, built an altar at Huo Mountain to make a report, obtained a stone coffin, inscribed: 'The Emperor commands Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's disorder, grants you this stone coffin to make your clan flourish.'

sentences.zh: 死，遂葬於霍太山。

translations.literal: When he died, he was buried at Huo Mountain.
translations.idiomatic: When he died, he was buried at Huo Mountain.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉復有子曰季勝。

translations.literal: Fei Lian again had a son named Ji Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian again had a son named Ji Sheng.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou, this was Zhai Gao Lang.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou, this was Zhai Gao Lang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.

sentences.zh: 造父以善御幸於周繆王，得驥、溫驪、驊騮、騄耳之駟，西巡狩，樂而忘歸。

translations.literal: Zao Fu, because he was skilled at driving chariots, was favored by King Mu of Zhou, obtained the team of Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, and Luo Er, went on western tour of inspection, enjoyed it and forgot to return.
translations.idiomatic: Zao Fu, because he was skilled at driving chariots, was favored by King Mu of Zhou, obtained the team of Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, and Luo Er, went on western tour of inspection, enjoyed it and forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 徐偃王作亂，造父為繆王御，長驅歸周，一日千里以救亂。

translations.literal: When King Xu Jian rebelled, Zao Fu drove for King Mu, drove long distance back to Zhou, one day a thousand li to save the disorder.
translations.idiomatic: When King Xu Jian rebelled, Zao Fu drove for King Mu, drove long distance back to Zhou, one day a thousand li to save the disorder.

sentences.zh: 繆王以趙城封造父，造父族由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city, Zao Fu's clan thereby became the Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city, Zao Fu's clan thereby became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自蜚廉生季勝已下五世至造父，別居趙。

translations.literal: From Fei Lian giving birth to Ji Sheng downward, five generations to Zao Fu, separately resided in Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: From Fei Lian giving birth to Ji Sheng downward, five generations to Zao Fu, separately resided in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙衰其後也。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai was his descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai was his descendant.

sentences.zh: 惡來革者，蜚廉子也，蚤死。

translations.literal: E Lai Ge was Fei Lian's son, died young.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai Ge was Fei Lian's son, died young.

sentences.zh: 有子曰女防。

translations.literal: Had a son named Nü Fang.
translations.idiomatic: Had a son named Nü Fang.

sentences.zh: 女防生旁皋，旁皋生太幾，太幾生大駱，大駱生非子。

translations.literal: Nü Fang gave birth to Pang Gao, Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji, Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo, Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Nü Fang gave birth to Pang Gao, Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji, Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo, Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi.

sentences.zh: 以造父之寵，皆蒙趙城，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: Because of Zao Fu's favor, all received enfeoffment of Zhao city, surnamed Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: Because of Zao Fu's favor, all received enfeoffment of Zhao city, surnamed Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 非子居犬丘，好馬及畜，善養息之。

translations.literal: Fei Zi resided in Quan Qiu, loved horses and livestock, was skilled at raising and breeding them.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Zi resided in Quan Qiu, loved horses and livestock, was skilled at raising and breeding them.

sentences.zh: 犬丘人言之周孝王，孝王召使主馬于汧渭之閒，馬大蕃息。

translations.literal: Quan Qiu people spoke of it to King Xiao of Zhou, King Xiao summoned him to manage horses between Qian and Wei, horses greatly multiplied.
translations.idiomatic: Quan Qiu people spoke of it to King Xiao of Zhou, King Xiao summoned him to manage horses between Qian and Wei, horses greatly multiplied.

sentences.zh: 孝王欲以為大駱適嗣。

translations.literal: King Xiao wished to make him the legitimate heir of Daliang.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiao wished to make him the legitimate heir of Daliang.

sentences.zh: 申侯之女為大駱妻，生子成為適。

translations.literal: The daughter of Shen Hou became Daliang's wife, and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the legitimate heir.
translations.idiomatic: The daughter of Shen Hou became Daliang's wife, and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the legitimate heir.

sentences.zh: 申侯乃言孝王曰：「昔我先酈山之女，為戎胥軒妻，生中潏，以親故歸周，保西垂，西垂以其故和睦。

translations.literal: Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao saying: 'In ancient times, my ancestor from Li Mountain became the wife of Xuxuan the Rong, and gave birth to Zhongyan. Because of kinship ties, she returned to Zhou and protected the western border. The western border was harmonious because of this.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao saying: 'In ancient times, my ancestor from Li Mountain became the wife of Xuxuan the Rong, and gave birth to Zhongyan. Because of kinship ties, she returned to Zhou and protected the western border. The western border was harmonious because of this.

sentences.zh: 今我復與大駱妻，生適子成。

translations.literal: Now I again married my daughter to Daliang, giving birth to the legitimate son Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Now I again married my daughter to Daliang, giving birth to the legitimate son Cheng.

sentences.zh: 申駱重婚，西戎皆服，所以為王。

translations.literal: Shen and Liang have intermarried twice; the western Rong all submit. This is for the sake of the king.'
translations.idiomatic: Shen and Liang have intermarried twice; the western Rong all submit. This is for the sake of the king.'

sentences.zh: 王其圖之。」

translations.literal: Please consider this.'
translations.idiomatic: Please consider this.'

sentences.zh: 於是孝王曰：「昔伯翳為舜主畜，畜多息，故有土，賜姓嬴。

translations.literal: Therefore King Xiao said: 'In ancient times, Bai Yi raised livestock for Shun; the livestock greatly multiplied, therefore he received land and was granted the surname Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore King Xiao said: 'In ancient times, Bai Yi raised livestock for Shun; the livestock greatly multiplied, therefore he received land and was granted the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 今其後世亦為朕息馬，朕其分土為附庸。」

translations.literal: Now his descendants also breed horses for me; I will divide land as a fief.'
translations.idiomatic: Now his descendants also breed horses for me; I will divide land as a fief.'

sentences.zh: 邑之秦，使復續嬴氏祀，號曰秦嬴。

translations.literal: He enfeoffed them at Qin, to continue the Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed them at Qin, to continue the Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying.

sentences.zh: 亦不廢申侯之女子為駱適者，以和西戎。

translations.literal: He also did not reject Shen Hou's daughter as Daliang's legitimate wife, to pacify the western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: He also did not reject Shen Hou's daughter as Daliang's legitimate wife, to pacify the western Rong.

He also did not reject Shen Hou's daughter as Daliang's legitimate wife, to pacify the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦嬴生秦侯。

translations.literal: Cheng's son was Duke Zhuang of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng's son was Duke Zhuang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦侯立十年，卒。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang's son was Duke Xiang of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang's son was Duke Xiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 生公伯。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Gong Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Gave birth to Gong Bo.

sentences.zh: 公伯立三年，卒。

translations.literal: Gong Bo ruled for three years, died.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo ruled for three years, died.

sentences.zh: 生秦仲。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Gave birth to Qin Zhong.

translations.literal: Cheng's son was Duke Zhuang of Qin. Duke Zhuang's son was Duke Xiang of Qin. Gave birth to Gong Bo. Gong Bo ruled for three years, died. Gave birth to Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立三年，周厲王無道，諸侯或叛之。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong ruled for three years. King Li of Zhou was tyrannical, some feudal lords rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for three years. King Li of Zhou was tyrannical, some feudal lords rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 西戎反王室，滅犬丘大駱之族。

translations.literal: The Western Rong rebelled against the royal house, extinguished the Quan Qiu and Da Liang clans.
translations.idiomatic: The Western Rong rebelled against the royal house, extinguished the Quan Qiu and Da Liang clans.

sentences.zh: 周宣王即位，乃以秦仲為大夫，誅西戎。

translations.literal: When King Xuan of Zhou ascended, he made Qin Zhong a minister, to punish the Western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: When King Xuan of Zhou ascended, he made Qin Zhong a minister, to punish the Western Rong.

sentences.zh: 西戎殺秦仲。

translations.literal: The Western Rong killed Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: The Western Rong killed Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立二十三年，死於戎。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong ruled for twenty-three years, died among the Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for twenty-three years, died among the Rong.

sentences.zh: 有子五人，其長者曰莊公。

translations.literal: Had five sons, the eldest was Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: Had five sons, the eldest was Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 周宣王乃召莊公昆弟五人，與兵七千人，使伐西戎，破之。

translations.literal: King Xuan of Zhou then summoned Duke Zhuang and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, sent them to attack the Western Rong, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan of Zhou then summoned Duke Zhuang and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, sent them to attack the Western Rong, defeated them.

sentences.zh: 於是復予秦仲後，及其先大駱地犬丘并有之，為西垂大夫。

translations.literal: Thus he restored to Qin Zhong's descendants, and gave them their former Da Liang territory Quan Qiu to possess together, made him Minister of the Western Frontier.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he restored to Qin Zhong's descendants, and gave them their former Da Liang territory Quan Qiu to possess together, made him Minister of the Western Frontier.

translations.literal: Qin Zhong ruled for three years. King Li of Zhou was tyrannical, some feudal lords rebelled against him. Thus he restored to Qin Zhong's descendants, and gave them their former Da Liang territory Quan Qiu to possess together, made him Minister of the Western Frontier.

sentences.zh: 莊公居其故西犬丘，生子三人，其長男世父。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang resided in his former western Quan Qiu, gave birth to three sons, the eldest son Shi Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang resided in his former western Quan Qiu, gave birth to three sons, the eldest son Shi Fu.

sentences.zh: 世父曰：「戎殺我大父仲，我非殺戎王則不敢入邑。」

translations.literal: Shi Fu said: 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong, I will not dare enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Fu said: 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong, I will not dare enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.'

sentences.zh: 遂將擊戎，讓其弟襄公。

translations.literal: Then he led troops to attack the Rong, yielded to his younger brother Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he led troops to attack the Rong, yielded to his younger brother Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 襄公為太子。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 莊公立四十四年，卒，太子襄公代立。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang ruled for forty-four years, died, Crown Prince Duke Xiang succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang ruled for forty-four years, died, Crown Prince Duke Xiang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，以女弟繆嬴為豐王妻。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang's first year, married his younger sister Mu Ying as wife to the Feng king.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang's first year, married his younger sister Mu Ying as wife to the Feng king.

sentences.zh: 襄公二年，戎圍犬丘，（世父）世父擊之，為戎人所虜。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang's second year, the Rong besieged Quan Qiu, Shi Fu attacked them, was captured by the Rong people.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang's second year, the Rong besieged Quan Qiu, Shi Fu attacked them, was captured by the Rong people.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，復歸世父。

translations.literal: After more than a year, Shi Fu returned.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a year, Shi Fu returned.

translations.literal: Duke Mu heard Baili Xi was worthy, wanted to ransom him with a high price, feared Chu would not give him, so sent someone to tell Chu: 'My concubine's servant Baili Xi is there, please ransom him with five black ram skins.'

translations.idiomatic: Chu people then agreed to give him.

sentences.zh: 當是時，百里傒年已七十餘。

translations.literal: At this time, Baili Xi was already over seventy years old.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Baili Xi was already over seventy years old.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu released him from prison, discussed state affairs with him.

translations.idiomatic: Declined saying: 'I am a minister of a ruined state, why ask me!'

translations.literal: Duke Mu said: 'The Yu lord did not employ you, therefore perished; it was not your crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'The Yu lord did not employ you, therefore perished; it was not your crime.'

sentences.zh: 固問，語三日，繆公大說，授之國政，號曰五羖大夫。

translations.literal: Insisted on asking, talked for three days, Duke Mu was greatly pleased, entrusted him with state administration, titled him Minister of Five Black Rams.
translations.idiomatic: Insisted on asking, talked for three days, Duke Mu was greatly pleased, entrusted him with state administration, titled him Minister of Five Black Rams.

sentences.zh: 百里傒讓曰：「臣不及臣友蹇叔，蹇叔賢而世莫知。

translations.literal: Baili Xi declined saying: 'I am not as good as my friend Jian Shu. Jian Shu is worthy but the world does not know it.
translations.idiomatic: Baili Xi declined saying: 'I am not as good as my friend Jian Shu. Jian Shu is worthy but the world does not know it.

sentences.zh: 臣常游困於齊而乞食铚人，蹇叔收臣。

translations.literal: I once wandered destitute in Qi and begged for food from people of Zhi; Jian Shu took me in.
translations.idiomatic: I once wandered destitute in Qi and begged for food from people of Zhi; Jian Shu took me in.

sentences.zh: 臣因而欲事齊君無知，蹇叔止臣，臣得脫齊難，遂之周。

translations.literal: I therefore wanted to serve Qi lord Wuzhi; Jian Shu stopped me, I escaped the Qi disaster, then went to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: I therefore wanted to serve Qi lord Wuzhi; Jian Shu stopped me, I escaped the Qi disaster, then went to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周王子穨好牛，臣以養牛干之。

translations.literal: Zhou prince Dai loved cattle; I approached him by raising cattle.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou prince Dai loved cattle; I approached him by raising cattle.

sentences.zh: 及穨欲用臣，蹇叔止臣，臣去，得不誅。

translations.literal: When Dai wanted to employ me, Jian Shu stopped me; I left, avoided execution.
translations.idiomatic: When Dai wanted to employ me, Jian Shu stopped me; I left, avoided execution.

translations.literal: Serving the Yu lord, Jian Shu stopped me.
translations.idiomatic: Serving the Yu lord, Jian Shu stopped me.

translations.literal: I knew the Yu lord would not employ me; I truly sought personal profit in rank and salary, so stayed.
translations.idiomatic: I knew the Yu lord would not employ me; I truly sought personal profit in rank and salary, so stayed.

translations.idiomatic: Autumn, Duke Mu personally led troops to attack Jin, fought at Hequ.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin died.

translations.idiomatic: Established Li Ji's son Xi Qi; his minister Li Ke killed Xi Qi.

translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi; Ke again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi.

translations.literal: Yiwu sent people to request Qin, seeking to enter Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Yiwu sent people to request Qin, seeking to enter Jin.

translations.idiomatic: Therefore Duke Mu agreed, sent Baili Xi to lead troops escorting Yiwu.

translations.idiomatic: When they arrived, he was already established, but sent Pi Zheng to thank Qin, reneged on the agreement and did not give the cities west of the river, and killed Li Ke.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu agreed, sent someone with Pi Zheng to return, summoned Lü and Xi.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'If the common people were truly not close, how could they execute their ministers?

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qi's Guan Zhong and Xi Peng died.

sentences.zh: 晉旱，來請粟。

translations.literal: Jin suffered drought, came to request grain.
translations.idiomatic: Jin suffered drought, came to request grain.

sentences.zh: 丕豹說繆公勿與，因其饑而伐之。

translations.literal: Pi Bao persuaded Duke Mu not to give it, to take advantage of their hunger and attack them.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Bao persuaded Duke Mu not to give it, to take advantage of their hunger and attack them.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu asked Gong Sun Zhi, Zhi said: 'Famine and abundance alternate, we cannot not give.'

translations.idiomatic: Asked Baili Xi, Xi said: 'Yi Wu offended his lord, but what crime have his common people committed?'

translations.idiomatic: Therefore followed Baili Xi and Gong Sun Zhi's advice, in the end gave grain to them.

translations.idiomatic: On the day of departure, Bai Li Xi and Jian Shu wept for them.

translations.idiomatic: Zhou King Sun Man said: 'Qin army is discourteous, if not defeated, what are they waiting for!'

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin showed him palaces and storehouses.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu was surprised, asked: 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws to govern, yet still has frequent disorder; now the Rong and Di have none of this, how do they govern, is it not difficult?'

translations.idiomatic: You Yu laughed, said: 'This is precisely why China is chaotic.

translations.idiomatic: Since the supreme sage Yellow Emperor created ritual, music, and laws, leading by example, barely achieved minor order.

translations.idiomatic: The Rong king will find it strange, will certainly suspect You Yu.

translations.literal: The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin. You Yu, his ancestors were Jin people, fled into the Rong, could speak Jin language. Heard Duke Mu was worthy, so sent You Yu to observe Qin. Duke Mu of Qin showed him palaces and storehouses. You Yu said: 'If ghosts made them, it would tire the spirits. If people made them, it would exhaust the people.' Duke Mu was surprised, asked: 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws to govern, yet still has frequent disorder; now the Rong and Di have none of this, how do they govern, is it not difficult?' You Yu laughed, said: 'This is precisely why China is chaotic. Since the supreme sage Yellow Emperor created ritual, music, and laws, leading by example, barely achieved minor order. By later generations, daily becoming more arrogant and licentious. They rely on the majesty of laws to demand and supervise below; below exhausted to the extreme then use benevolence and righteousness to resent and look up at above; above and below contend in resentment and mutually usurp and assassinate, even to the point of destroying clans, all of this type. The Rong and Di are not like this. Above embraces pure virtue to treat below, below harbors loyalty and faith to serve above; a state's governance is like one body's order, not knowing how it is governed, this is truly the sage's governance.' Therefore Duke Mu withdrew and asked Interior Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that a neighboring state having a sage is an enemy state's worry. Now You Yu is worthy, my harm, what shall I do about it?' Interior Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king lives in remote seclusion, has not heard China's sounds. Your majesty try sending him female musicians, to seize his will; make requests for You Yu, to widen the gap between them; keep him and don't send him back, to miss his deadline. The Rong king will find it strange, will certainly suspect You Yu. When ruler and minister have a rift, then they can be captured. Moreover the Rong king loves music, will certainly be remiss in governance.' Duke Mu said: 'Good.' Therefore sat with You Yu on curved mats, passed vessels and ate, questioned thoroughly about their terrain and military strength, and then ordered Interior Scribe Liao to send the Rong king sixteen female musicians. The Rong king received them and was delighted, stayed a whole year without returning. Therefore Qin then returned You Yu. You Yu repeatedly admonished but was not listened to, Duke Mu repeatedly sent people to intercept and urge You Yu, You Yu then left and defected to Qin. Duke Mu treated him with guest courtesy, questioned about the strategy for attacking the Rong.

translations.idiomatic: Killed Chu Zi and his mother, drowned them by the deep pool.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.literal: Duke Wu took a Wei woman as queen, had no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu took a Wei woman as queen, had no sons.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.literal: Established different mother younger brother, this was Duke Zhaoxiang.
translations.idiomatic: Established different mother younger brother, this was Duke Zhaoxiang.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.literal: Duke Zhaoxiang's mother was Chu person, surname Mi, titled Xuan Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhaoxiang's mother was Chu person, surname Mi, titled Xuan Dowager.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.literal: When Duke Wu died, Duke Zhaoxiang was hostage in Yan, Yan people sent him back, thus was established.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wu died, Duke Zhaoxiang was hostage in Yan, Yan people sent him back, thus was established.

translations.literal: Duke Wu first year, met with Wei Hui Wang at Linjin. Executed Shu chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang both sent east to Wei. Attacked Yiqiu, Dan, Li. Second year, first established chancellor position, Li Ji and Gan Mao became left and right chancellors. Zhang Yi died in Wei. Third year, met with Han Xiang Wang outside Linjin. Nan Gong Jie died, Li Ji became prime minister of Han. Duke Wu said to Gan Mao: 'I wish to have chariots pass through the three river valleys, gaze upon the Zhou house, then die without regret.' That autumn, sent Gan Mao and Senior Minister Feng to attack Yiyang. Fourth year, captured Yiyang, beheaded 60,000. Crossed the Yellow River, fortified Wusui. Wei crown prince came to court. Duke Wu was strong and fond of games, strongmen Ren Bi, Wu Huo, Meng Yue all reached high office. The king competed with Meng Yue in lifting the ding tripod, ruptured his kneecap. Eighth month, Duke Wu died. Executed Meng Yue and his entire clan. Duke Wu took a Wei woman as queen, had no sons. Established different mother younger brother, this was Duke Zhaoxiang. Duke Zhaoxiang's mother was Chu person, surname Mi, titled Xuan Dowager. When Duke Wu died, Duke Zhaoxiang was hostage in Yan, Yan people sent him back, thus was established.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.literal: Duke Zhaoxiang first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhaoxiang first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.literal: Gan Mao went out to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao went out to Wei.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Second year, comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: Second year, comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.literal: Senior Minister Zhuang with ministers, lords, princes rebelled, all executed, and Duke Huiwen's queen all did not die good deaths.
translations.idiomatic: Senior Minister Zhuang with ministers, lords, princes rebelled, all executed, and Duke Huiwen's queen all did not die good deaths.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.literal: Dao Duke Wu's queen went out and returned to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Dao Duke Wu's queen went out and returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: Third year, king crowned.
translations.idiomatic: Third year, king crowned.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.literal: Met with Chu king at Huang Ji, ceded Shangyong to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Met with Chu king at Huang Ji, ceded Shangyong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fourth year, took Puban.
translations.idiomatic: Fourth year, took Puban.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: Comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wei king came to court at Yingting, returned Puban to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Fifth year, Wei king came to court at Yingting, returned Puban to Wei.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Shu lord Hui rebelled, Sima Cuo pacified Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Sixth year, Shu lord Hui rebelled, Sima Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.literal: Senior Minister Huan attacked Chu, beheaded 20,000.
translations.idiomatic: Senior Minister Huan attacked Chu, beheaded 20,000.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Jingyang Jun went as hostage to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jingyang Jun went as hostage to Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.literal: Solar eclipse, day darkened.
translations.idiomatic: Solar eclipse, day darkened.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.literal: Seventh year, took Xincheng.
translations.idiomatic: Seventh year, took Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.literal: Mang Li Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Li Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.literal: Eighth year, sent General Mi Yong to attack Chu, took Xinshi.
translations.idiomatic: Eighth year, sent General Mi Yong to attack Chu, took Xinshi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.literal: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fangcheng, took Tangmei.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fangcheng, took Tangmei.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.literal: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan, its ruler fled, finally died in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan, its ruler fled, finally died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.literal: Wei prince Jing, Han prince Chang became lords.
translations.idiomatic: Wei prince Jing, Han prince Chang became lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Lord Mengchang Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Ninth year, Lord Mengchang Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.literal: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, killed their general Jing Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, killed their general Jing Kuai.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Chu King Huai entered to court Qin, Qin detained him.
translations.idiomatic: Tenth year, Chu King Huai entered to court Qin, Qin detained him.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.literal: Xue Wen took gold and was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Xue Wen took gold and was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.literal: Lou Huan became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Lou Huan became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, Zhongshan five states together attacked Qin, reached Yanshi and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, Zhongshan five states together attacked Qin, reached Yanshi and returned.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.literal: Qin and Han, Wei made peace with the land north of Yellow River and Fengling.
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Han, Wei made peace with the land north of Yellow River and Fengling.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Qin Shi Huang ascended, his son Qin Er Shi ascended.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi first year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.literal: Second year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.literal: Third year, Qin Er Shi died.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.literal: Too史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黄氏、江氏、脩魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.literal: Chancellor Li Si killed Fusu, established Huhai as Qin Er Shi.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.literal: The six states rose together, Qin destroyed them all.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang unified the world, made himself emperor.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.literal: He toured the eastern states, erected stone inscriptions.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.literal: He burned books and buried scholars.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.literal: He built the Great Wall, dug the Ling Canal.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.literal: He sought immortals, sent Xu Fu to sea.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.literal: He died at Shaqiu, Huhai became emperor.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: The ministers Zhao Gao and Li Si plotted rebellion.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang rose in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.literal: Zhang Han attacked the rebels, but the Qin dynasty fell.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.literal: Liu Bang entered Guanzhong, became king of Han.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu destroyed Qin, divided the lands.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Wei, took Linjin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Zhao, took Anyi.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Qi, took Linzi.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.literal: Liu Bang attacked Chu, took Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu counterattacked, defeated Han at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.literal: Han Xin defeated Qi, Liu Bang defeated Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.literal: Battle of Gaixia, Xiang Yu committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.literal: Liu Bang became emperor, established the Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.literal: Han Gao Zu first year, attacked Qin remnants.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.literal: Second year, pacified the various lords.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.literal: Third year, attacked Chu remnants.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。

translations.literal: Fourth year, attacked Qi remnants.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Zhao remnants.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.literal: Sixth year, attacked Yan remnants.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Seventh year, attacked Wei remnants.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.literal: Eighth year, attacked Dai remnants.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.literal: Ninth year, pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.literal: Han Gao Zu died, Empress Lü acted as regent.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.literal: Wen Di ascended, practiced benevolent government.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.literal: Jing Di ascended, continued the policies.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.literal: Wu Di ascended, expanded the empire.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.literal: Wu Di died, Zhao Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.literal: Zhao Di died, Xuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.literal: Xuan Di died, Yuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.literal: Yuan Di died, Cheng Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.literal: Cheng Di died, Ai Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.literal: Ai Di died, Ping Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.literal: Ping Di died, Ruzi Ying ascended.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.literal: Wang Mang usurped the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.literal: Liu Xiu restored the Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.literal: Guang Wu Di ascended, pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.literal: Ming Di ascended, continued the legacy.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.literal: Zhang Di ascended, promoted Confucianism.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, An Guo Jun became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Xuan Taihou died, buried at Zhiyang Lishan.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Rang Hou was exiled to Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.literal: Forty-third year, Wu An Jun Bai Qi attacked Han, took nine cities, beheaded 50,000.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.literal: Forty-fourth year, attacked Han Nanyang, took it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, Wu Da Fu Ben attacked Han, took ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.literal: Forty-sixth year, attacked Zhao, took Guanglang.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Hua.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Wu'an.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.literal: Forty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Gaoqiu.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.literal: Fifty-first year, Zhao Hao became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.literal: Fifty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.literal: Fifty-third year, attacked Zhao, took Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.literal: Fifty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: Fifty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Hequ.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.literal: Fifty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.literal: Fifty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Yewang.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.literal: Fifty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.literal: Fifty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.literal: Sixtieth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.literal: Sixty-first year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.literal: Sixty-second year, attacked Wei, took Anyi.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.literal: Sixty-third year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.literal: Sixty-fourth year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.literal: Sixty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.literal: Sixty-sixth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: Eighty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

translations.literal: Eighty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.
